lines.text:
[narration]
It was 1962. Willie and me had been traveling through the night, running from a crime we never committed. Willie was still driving pretty good, considering he had a bullet in his body and all.

[to a dozing Willie]
Sure is strange to be driving on this side of the road...
That lady right there has a phone in her dress.
You can't freeze people like hamburger.
Willie, what about my new kidney?
The reason for time is so everything doesn't happen all at once, Willie.
That wall there just gave that lady money.
I used to give you rides on my back when you were just a little girl. You're too big for that now.

I knew it, Willie was right. As long as you keep trying, everything always works out in the end. Even for a guy like me. I flew up to Minnesota and got myself a brand new kidney, with a lifetime guarantee. See ya later...
